items.prompt: How is our class different from other classes?

choices.text: We watch videos at home and work in groups together in class.

items.prompt: How is this method like learning our first language?

choices.text: We just start doing it and get better by repetition
We drink milk and get burped while we're learning

items.prompt: What point am I making about learning concepts in parallel?

choices.text: Traditionally focusing on one concept at a time doesn't require us to identify which concept is important
It's not possible to learn one concept without learning the others

items.prompt: I'm listing advantages for 'lecture videos'. What are some advantages?

choices.text: You can stop the video and repeat things that are not clear
You can call my cell phone to ask questions
You can discuss videos with your colleagues, and bring questions to class.

items.prompt: Peer Instruction' is when students learn from each other. What do studies show?

choices.text: Students learn better from other students than from an instructor.
The student who isÂ helping the other students also greatly benefits from peer instruction

items.prompt: What resources are publicly available for this class?
What skill do I imply is the most important?

title: Different Way to Learn Physics
category: Become familiar with our learning model
